intro: Tragia pruricus, commonly known as the prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its wide distribution. Tragia pruricus is also known for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
